intro: Diplotaxis sieberi, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it produces yellow flowers in clusters. Its seed capsules split open to release seeds with feathery appendages, aiding in wind dispersal. Diplotaxis sieberi is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
